intro: Amyema gravis, commonly known as the sicklepod, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive sickle-shaped seed pods. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by the development of its unique pod structure. Amyema gravis is often found in disturbed habitats and can be an invasive species in some areas.
